website_summaries.verdict: Works very well, if slowly, and is very portable. The fact that the sun has to be shining limits its use, however.
pros: Lightweight and folds up to the size of a laptop
Comes with a thermometer, trivet, collapsible silicone pot, cooking guide, and carry bag
Easy to set up and use
cons: Needs to be pointed at the sun, so you may spend a lot of time adjusting its position
Does not work at night, or when it's cloudy
temperature range is around 175 to 225 degrees Fahrenheit

customer_reviews.title: Bacteria Incubator
customer_reviews.text: I tried the Sunflair Mini Portable Solar Oven on a hot, sunny day in Honolulu. I achieved a maximum temperature of 150 - 155 degrees Fahrenheit inside the oven. This is warm enough to grow bacteria, but not nearly hot enough to heat food to a safe temperature. After 6 hours in the solar oven, my baked potatoes were still raw, although a little warm. I had to finish baking them in my conventional electric oven. The product is useless at best, and unsafe if the user does not check the food's temperature with a food thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Perfect hard cooked eggs
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my Sunflair Mini! My first experiment was hard cooked eggs. No water needed. I cooked them for an hour and fifteen minutes and they were perfect. Today I am baking sweet potatoes. I bought it to take camping in my van but am enjoying using it at home until I hit the road. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: CJColorado

customer_reviews.title: Great for warming / reheating
customer_reviews.text: I live in a camper van and this has been a fantastic way to reheat food. Being that it's winter, I haven't really tried to do full on cooking with it yet (highest it's reached so far is 200). For warming up cold food (I have a weird love of hot bananas) / reheating leftovers, this thing is great. While you'd expect it to be a very dry heat, it surprisingly holds quite a bit of moisture in (and I'm in a desert). I rarely eat anything I don't cook, but I did get to test this once on reheating pizza from the day before and I'm convinced it was actually better than when it was fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It works. I've cooked a lot of stuff during the summer, and it almost always turns out great. I like to put a dutch oven inside of my solar oven. The heat is enough to cook ribs so tender they fell of the bone. The only drawback to this is that it needs to point at the sun, so occasionally adjusting the oven's position is needed. Maybe I will invent a platform to put these guys on that automatically follows the sun based on GPS position.
customer_reviews.author: RTLeBaron

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly efficient!
customer_reviews.text: Surprising how fast this heats up in full sunlight. Heating precooked or canned food is certainly no problem. I am still experimenting with "from scratch" cooking. Some might prefer the bigger model, but this is a nice entry into solar cooking. Little cookbook included. Folds up and fits nicely in your backpack, right in that laptop area some have.
customer_reviews.author: JoJoJava

customer_reviews.title: Effortless, Miraculous Solar Cooking
customer_reviews.text: I've been using my Sunflair mini solar oven almost every day since I received it in the mail a couple of weeks ago, and I'm LOVING it! I've made meatloaf, ratatouille, French-style beef stew, and pasta sauce, just to name a few. Everything has turned out delicious. This solar oven is a little miracle -- light, portable, affordable, practical, and oh-so-easy to use. If you get full sun during most days -- as I do here in Mexico now -- you must get this solar oven and let the sun do your cooking for you, effortlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Lee Black

customer_reviews.title: This thing is too damn cool. Fits in my back packing pack perfectly with ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is too damn cool. Fits in my back packing pack perfectly with hardly any real difference in weight. Main reason I like it is it saves on my tinder and effort for a fire while back packing if I want a hot meal. Super easy set up. I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Sefferino

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for a solar oven!!
customer_reviews.text: I am currently in Kuwait and thought “hey we have all this sun and heat, I’am pretty sure that we can cook something out here.” So I googled solar ovens and the sun flair came up. The price seemed reasonable. The first thing that we cooked was apple crisp. It was amazing! We then cooked peach cobbler and it wasn’t to bad either. We then tried a Mexican cheese dip. That was pretty good too. My oven has consistently reached 200 degrees. I am considering the bigger oven. It gets a thumbs up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful device. In learning about solar cooking I built a few primitive models myself. Eventually I'll likely go for the GoSun grill, but this solar oven is absolutely excellent. As a vandweller who works during the day, I leave it on my roof full of raw veggies, chicken, and broth, and always come home to a perfectly cooked stew at the end of the day. Uv index is crucial. It only works in true sunshine, on cloudy days it is useless. But it has cooked me many a meal and will continue to. Well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Melody G

customer_reviews.title: Really only big enough for one person meals.
customer_reviews.text: This is actually too small for my smallest pan. The pan that comes with it is really just right for only one person. I don’t fault the product....I just need a bigger oven to cook for 3.
customer_reviews.author: Katie33kate

customer_reviews.title: Not enough to feed a bird
customer_reviews.text: I would suggest getting the larger model; the amount this model prepares isn't enough to feed a bird.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara R

customer_reviews.title: This is great! I forgot to pack my usual camper's stove ...
customer_reviews.text: This is great! I forgot to pack my usual camper's stove so relied on the Sunflower at the June land speed racing event in southern California. I sat it on my vehicle's hood, pointed it at the sun and I had hot veggie burgers, melted cheese, and heated bun in no time. I love the thermometer.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Jeffries

customer_reviews.title: Big Results out of Mini Solar Oven.
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize for the price I had ordered the mini. But it will serve it's purpose. I needed small and compact solar oven and this products provides that. Although in C. FL. it took 4 hrs on a typical hot day with outside temps in high 80's to cook 6 eggs instead of recipe saying 1.5 hr. The silicone pan included doesn't heat as well as a dark metal pan, but again it collapses and I will use it adjusting accordingly. I will continue testing different recipes and timing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works as it says, better that expected
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my husband, was using foil in his car window to cook, this was an upgrade! He loves it uses it at work, camping and even a raft trip! It’s small but you can fit a decent amount inside, he usually just cooks 2 burritos and they are Hot!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Great design, fun to use
customer_reviews.text: I love it. Easy to use and heats up quickly. I like the recipe book. I use this with students, so it's a great teaching tool. My only complaint is the weather, which has been so cloudy lately. It pays to plan ahead and make sure you have a cloudless day, as it is otherwise difficult to maintain proper cooking temperature.
customer_reviews.author: Naga

customer_reviews.title: It does the job
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the small oven 9 months ago and use twice a month camping. It works great for my needs heating up cans or prepackaged food. I'm not sold on cooking rice due to the time it would take and how even the rice would cook. So I bring cooked rice or leftovers and warm up instead. I recommend this product and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little solar oven. Tested it the day it arrived. 32 degrees out and the oven got up to 175 degrees.
customer_reviews.author: Question everything.

customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. So very practical for being out in the desert. I adore being able to cook outdoors without the threat of winds starting a fire.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good but not as effective as I wanted it to be
customer_reviews.text: It got up to about 175F and wouldn't go higher. This is in direct sunlight in San Diego in April. There's not a very easy way to tilt it up to receive more sunlight without toppling over the water you're trying to boil or meal you're trying to cook. I really like the effort but the execution wasn't quite there.

customer_reviews.title: Great product and

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I got it up to 220°F. I made rice and quinoa no problem in a few hours. It is basically a slow cooker. However, I now wish I had gotten the larger one as this capacity on this dude is rather limited.

customer_reviews.title: Very excellent
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used the sunflair mini it was on the weekend with the shortest day of the year and it heated up some frozen food. I cooked almost every day with it for over a year in central California. Lite weight, durable and easy. Haze by the beach dropped the temperature about 10 or 20 degrees Fahrenheit but still worked well.

customer_reviews.title: but it seems like it would fit into a backpack for a hiking ...
customer_reviews.text: It is about the size of a bulky binder, but it is surprisingly lightweight and somewhat pliable. You wouldn't have to worry about squashing it as it is flexible enough to conform to the other contents in the backpack. I anticipate it will come in handy for hiking trips while camping.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Solar Oven Kit

product_meta.title: Sunflair Mini Portable Solar Oven
feature_bullets: #1 Portable Solar Oven from Alaska to Afghanistan! Cook from sun-up to sundown.
Includes: 1 solar oven thermometer, 1 trivet, 1 collapsible silicone pot, and a handy stuff bag. No assembly required. Easy to use. Sets up and stores in seconds.
Cook where open flames are not allowed. Possible to cook in some vehicles. (Cook Responsibly!)

World's lightest and easiest solar oven; floats and dries quickly; folds to the size of a laptop; hiking, boating, fishing, beach, construction sites, RV-ing, tiny houses, camper trailers, educational learning, emergencies, bug out bags, and zombie apocalypse.
Sunflair donates a portion of our proceeds toward providing a safer, healthier, and greener cooking experience for all, both here at home and across the globe.
